persistent.name: [Colorize] PF2e HUD - Persistent HUD
persistent.hint: Colorize the 'Persistent HUD' feature of 'PF2e HUD'

roll.name: [Colorize] PF2e Toolbelt - Target helper Roll Types
roll.hint: Colorize the 'Target helper' feature of 'PF2e Toolbelt' so that each roll type is colorized

item-property-runes.name: [Display] Item Property Runes
item-property-runes.hint: When you go to look an item's sheet will add in the name and description of any Property Runes on the item

base-damage.name: [Display] Weapon Base Damage
base-damage.hint: Adds a little display below the price on weapon sheets that displays their base damage (Note: This includes any Striking runes the weapon has)

default-craft-checks.name: [Hide] Default Craft Checks Buttons
default-craft-checks.hint: To Prevent players from using default crafting as opposed to the 'Heroic Crafting' Buttons if using that addon

button-text.name: [Hide] Header Button Text
button-text.hint: Hides the header buttons' text, but keeps their icons in tact for this with a lot of modules

sell-all-treasure.name: [Hide] Sell All Treasure
sell-all-treasure.hint: Hides the 'Sell All Treasure' button to prevent accidentally selling key items

roll.name: [Highlight] PF2e Toolbelt - Target Helper Unrolled Roll
roll.hint: Highlight unmade rolls by making them glow in the 'Target helper' feature of 'PF2e Toolbelt' to make it more clear to roll it

languages-known.name: [Highlight] Which party Members know Creature Languages
languages-known.hint: Highlights which languages (on NPC stat block pages) are known by the current active party as well as adds a tooltip to make sure its clear

user-color.name: User Color for Message Headers
user-color.hint: Sets the header of messages based on the user color

simple-requests.name: [Minify] Simple Requests
simple-requests.hint: Makes 'Simple Requests' module HUD a bit smaller so its less in the way

recharge.name: [Notify] Spellstrike Recharge
recharge.hint: Adds a little ui notification when your spellstrike should be recharged

journal.name: [Notify] GM Start of Session Checklist (Journal)
journal.hint: This feature when enough players join will open a start of session checklist for the GM to ensure you don't forget anything. (To activate this feature set this setting to a Journal or Journal Page UUID)

journal-players.name: [Notify] Players Start of Session Checklist (Journal)
journal-players.hint: This feature when enough players join will open a start of session checklist for players to ensure the players don't forget anything. (To activate this feature set this setting to a Journal or Journal Page UUID)

players-needed.name: [Notify] Start of Session Checklist (Players Needed)
players-needed.hint: This is the minimum amount of Non-GM players needed to be active in the game for the checklist to show up (defaults to Player count - 1)

reaction-usage.name: [Track] Reaction Usage
reaction-usage.hint: This feature creates (and increments) an effect on a token that counts if a token has used a reaction. To note it also applies this effect to every token as combat starts if you have all enabled

pause-text.name: [Replace] Pause Text
pause-text.hint: Allows you to override the base pause text. This supports multiple pause text options from which it will pick randomly, separate each option with either '|' or ';'. (Set this setting blank to get the original pause text) (Also supports a Rolltable of options by setting this to the Table's UUID)

pause-img.name: [Replace] Pause Image
pause-img.hint: Allows you to override the base pause image.

pause-img-class.name: [Replace] Pause Image Class
pause-img-class.hint: Allows you to replace the class for the pause image (animation) see the options here (https://docs.fontawesome.com/web/style/animate) on fontawesome (Default is 'fa-spin')

player-notes.name: Open Character 'Campaign Notes'
player-notes.description: Opens an editable version of the player's assigned character's 'Campaign Notes' section of their character sheet

player-notes.no-character: No Notes to open as you have no assigned character nor selected character

session-start.active: [Session Start] Enough players have joined the lobby to show you the session start checklist!

spellstrike.conflux: You just cast a conflux spell which allows you to recharge your spellstrike.
spellstrike.feature: You used a feature that recharges your spellstrike
spellstrike.on-success: You used a feature that recharges your spellstrike if you succeeded on a roll
spellstrike.other-option: Alternatively you can always spend 1 action to recharge, this action has the concentrate trait
